data.title: The 55+ Best Movies With Secret in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 55+ Best Movies With Secret in the Title. Current Top 3: The Secret Garden, The Secret of NIMH, The Secret Life of Pets ...
data.text:
Ranked By

701 votes

156 voters

Voting Rules

Vote up your favorite movie with secret in the name.

Have you ever noticed how many movies there are with secret in the name? This list ranks the best movies with secret in the title, regardless of genre or rating. What is your favorite movie with secret in the name? This is kind of an odd way to categorize movies, but that's also why it's so fun! There are probably one or two movies with secret in the title that you instantly think of, but you might be surprised how many others there are too as you scroll through this list.

This ranked poll of films with secret in the title includes movies like The Secret of NIMH, Secret Window, and On Her Majesty's Secret Service. Don't forget that this list is interactive, meaning you can vote the film names up or down depending on much you liked each movie that has the word secret in it.

Most divisive: In the Secret Service

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 55+ Best Movies With Secret in the Title

Kate Maberly, Heydon Prowse, Maggie Smith

Based on the beloved children's novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett, this heartwarming adaptation follows a young girl orphaned in India who moves to her uncle's isolated manor in England. Upon discovering a hidden, magical garden on the property, she forms a bond with a lonely local boy and her sickly cousin as they unlock the garden's mysteries together. Its lush, picturesque cinematography and powerful themes of friendship, healing, and self-discovery make it an enduring favorite for all ages.

Released : 1993

Directed by : Agnieszka Holland

Also ranks # 106 on The Best Movies Roger Ebert Gave Four Stars

Also ranks # 269 on The Best Movies Of The '90s, Ranked

Also ranks # 82 on The 470+ Best Chick Flicks Ever

A dark, yet enchanting animated film that adapts Robert C. O'Brien's novel, this movie tells the story of a widowed mouse who discovers her family's home is threatened by a farmer's plow. Delving into the mysterious world of highly intelligent rats who escaped a laboratory called NIMH, the protagonist seeks their help to save her home and uncovers secrets about their past. The gripping plot, memorable characters, and exceptional animation make it a classic for all ages.

Released : 1982

Directed by : Don Bluth

Dig Deeper ‘The Secret of NIMH’ Scarred A Generation Of Children (And Has An Even Weirder Backstory)

Also ranks # 175 on The Best Movies Of The 1980s, Ranked

Also ranks # 103 on The 400+ Best Animated Kids Movies

In this charming ensemble comedy from the creators of Despicable Me, a group of domesticated animals living in a New York City apartment building find themselves on an unexpected adventure when their owners aren't around. Rivalries, friendships, and loyalty are put to the test as they navigate the city's streets, encountering various other pets and animals along the way. The film's vibrant animation, lovable characters, and humorous take on what pets do when left alone make for a fun-filled family experience.

Released : 2016

Directed by : Chris Renaud

Also ranks # 135 on The 400+ Best Animated Kids Movies

Also ranks # 182 on Things That Are Not As Cool As People Think They Are

Also ranks # 7 on The 120+ Best Movies For 10-Year-Old Kids

This sixth installment in the James Bond franchise stars George Lazenby as the iconic agent 007, replacing Sean Connery for the first (and only) time. Following the trail of his nemesis Blofeld, Bond infiltrates a mysterious allergy research facility in Switzerland, only to uncover a sinister plot involving global biological warfare. Despite initial controversy regarding Lazenby's casting, the film has gained acclaim for its thrilling action sequences, engaging plot, and a heart-wrenching ending that sets it apart from other entries in the series.

Released : 1969

Directed by : Peter Hunt

Dig Deeper Why 'On Her Majesty’s Secret Service' Is - And Always Will Be - The Weirdest Bond Movie Ever

Also ranks # 88 on The Greatest '60s Movies, Ranked

Also ranks # 213 on The Best Movie Scores Of All Time, Ranked

In a classic 80s comedy, Michael J. Fox stars as a young financial genius from Kansas who moves to New York City to make his mark on Wall Street. He quickly finds himself in over his head, juggling two identities and romancing a beautiful woman, all the while keeping up appearances at his day job. The film is well-loved for its clever plot twists, charismatic characters, and hilarious portrayals of corporate America.

Released : 1987

Directed by : Herbert Ross

Also ranks # 186 on The Best Movies Of The 1980s, Ranked

Also ranks # 275 on The All-Time Greatest Comedy Films

Also ranks # 85 on The Best '80s Comedy Movies, Ranked

Directed by Steven Spielberg and produced by Peter Jackson, this visually-stunning motion-capture animation adventure brings the beloved comic book series to life. Young journalist Tintin and his loyal dog, Snowy, are thrust into a globe-trotting adventure as they attempt to discover the secret behind a mysterious model ship. With a thrilling story, fast-paced action, and phenomenal animation, the film captures the spirit of the source material while introducing Tintin to a new generation of fans.

Released : 2011

Directed by : Steven Spielberg

Also ranks # 80 on The Greatest Comic Book Movies Of All Time

Also ranks # 313 on The 400+ Best Animated Kids Movies

Also ranks # 88 on 50+ Movies That Need Sequels
